means: 间歇，停顿，（放映电影中）中间休息

word_mean: 间歇期：两次发作之间的时期

sentence.Network_en: Coffee was served during the intermission.
sentence.Network_cn: 幕间休息时有咖啡供应。

sentence.Network_en: The violinist resumed playing after the intermission.
sentence.Network_cn: 幕间休息之后,那小提琴手又重新开始演奏.

sentence.Network_en: Fraser did not perform until after intermission.
sentence.Network_cn: 弗雷泽直到中场休息之后才上场。

the lubricating technology of intermission running vehicles is discussed ;, 讨论间歇运行车辆润滑技术;

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin intermissio(n-), from the verb intermittere (see intermit)

entry.tran: (电影、音乐会或演出的)幕间休息
entry.def: An intermission is a short break between two parts of a film, concert, or show.

example.ex: ...during the intermission of the musical 'Steppin' Out'.
example.tran: 在音乐剧《与情人共舞》的幕间休息期间

means.word_mean: 1. the act of suspending activity temporarily
2. a time interval during which there is a temporary cessation of something

auth_sentence.content: This eruption lasted two nights and two days without intermission.
